Text: τὸ Λούγδουνον / Αὐτὸ μὲν δὴ τὸ Λούγδουνον, ἐκτισμένον ὑπὸ λόφῳ κατὰ τὴν συμβολὴν τοῦ τε Ἄραρος τοῦ ποταμοῦ καὶ τοῦ Ῥοδανοῦ, κατέχουσι Ῥωμαῖοι.
τῶν Αἰδούων ἔθνος / οἱ δὲ Αἰδοῦοι / Αἰδοῦοι
Ὀσίσμιοι δ᾿ εἰσίν, οὓς Ὠστιμίους1 ὀνομάζει Πυθέας,
ὁ Ἑρκύνιος δρυμὸς /  Ὁ δὲ Ἑρκύνιος δρυμὸς
comment: Black Forest or forests of Hartz, woods of Westphalia and Nassau (Loeb cf. Elton, pp. 154-155); from 5 follows a larger description of this area.
according to Strabo, these are part of the Suevi and they 'dwell'(oikounta) in the forests -> have villages/settlements in wooded areas?

Text: ...ἡ μητρόπολις αὐτῶν Δουρικορτόρα μάλιστα συνοικεῖται καὶ δέχεται τοὺς τῶν Ῥωμαίων ἡγεμόνας.
comment: Strabo describes that the metropolis of the Remi is (Durocortora) densely built and that Roman governors had their residence here
Strabo describes this as a place (topon) and calls it the domain of King Marabodus -> he caused to migrate several people there, including his kinsmen - the Marcomanni

Text: … παρ᾿ οἷς ἐστι καὶ τὸ Ἴτιον, ᾧ ἐχρήσατο ναυστάθμῳ Καῖσαρ ὁ Θεός, διαίρων εἰς τὴν νῆσον· …
comment: Strabo describes that Caesar had a naval base at Itium for the crossing to Britain; Three identifications for Portus Itius are provided in the literature, all of them over a century old. Portus Itius is identified with the river mouth of the Liane in some literature (Raaflaub 2017, p. 123 cf. Keune, 1916, RE IX, p. 2367; see also Reddé 2014, pp. 29-30). This identification is at odds with an older identification of Portus Itius cf. Smith 1854, Dictionary of Greek and Roman Geography, lemma Portus Itius (followed by Pleiades), where the possibilities of Wissant or Sangatte are mentioned. In this record the RE interpretation (Boulogne as Portus Itius) is followed.

Text: ...καὶ τῶν Σοήβων αὐτῶν μέγα ἔθνος, Σέμνωνας.

comment: in book VII Strabo notes that the Suevi is the largest tribe and that they occupy the territory from Rhenus to Albios (Rhine to Elbe); Strabo remarks that some tribes of the Suevi dwell in forests, while others have a common boundary with the tribe of the Getae

tribe of the Suevi who are living on the far side (East?) of the Albios (Elbe) - Strabo mentions that at present time they all have been driven in flight from their home country towards the other side of the Elbe

Text: …ἀλλὰ καὶ τὰς ἐν τῷ παράπλῳ νήσους, ὧν ἐστι καὶ ἡ Βυρχανίς, ἣν ἐκ πολιορκίας εἷλε.
comment: same as 'Fabaria'- Bean Island - in Pliny NH IV.27
